reviewText: While Gina Gershon is featured on the cover of the DVD box, Rory Cochrane is actually the protagonist. He plays a rookie cop named Chris O'Brien, a devout Catholic who loses his innocence once he joins the police force and is partnered with Gershon's mentally unbalanced veteran cop, Officer Hugs. A rogue cop is driving around bumping off junkies and other low-lifes by shooting them in the left eye. The two cops engage in a steamy affair, and O'Brien is torn between his lust for Hugs and his suspicion that she may be the killer.Gershon and Cochrane definitely have chemistry and smoke up the screen. I liked how their love scenes were steamy without being really graphic. Gershon is good as the somewhat crazy older cop, and her performance is ambiguous enough that you are genuinely kept wondering whether or not she is really the killer. But I liked Cochrane even more as the hero who is trying to unravel the truth and coming apart and falling from grace. I have enjoyed him in films like A Scanner Darkly, The Company, and Right at Your Door and have always felt he is underrated as a actor. He should get more lead roles.The other performances in the movie are merely adequate. I thought Alison Eastwood as a detective was robotic.Otherwise, this film was a good erotic thriller and I would recommend it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you enjoy a movie with a basic plot, but with plenty of Gina Gershon then this IS it.  Gershon does a good job acting wise, but my God, there isn't one frame in this film where she isn't breath takingly HOT!  For all Gershon fans, check it out, and buy it for keeps.
summary: Gina Gershon is Hotter Than EVER!!

reviewText: I have recently watched Thief and Internal Affairs for the third or fourth time and both of these movies are still more engrossing than B & W which I saw for the first time. There are several flaws in this film not  least of all casting, directing and script! It starts off with high  expectations and quickly fizzles.

reviewText: Good cop\ba d cop is a hollywood staple, the only thing that raises this film,even a little bit, is the performance by the always wonderful and sexy GINA GERSHON.GINA, in this one MAY be a BAD cop and a KILLER. If this film had a better script, direction, and secondary cast it might come close to a film noir classic.But once again THE GREAT GINA is saddled with second rate back-up.GINA I love you,but the film is only so,so.
summary: GINA AS A HOT, HOT COP

reviewText: Not one of Gina Gershon's best roles.  The plot has plenty of twists and turns.  You won't know "who dunnit" until the very end of the film. Some interesting nude scenes.  If you're a Gina Gershon fan...buy  BOUND.  Much better.
